intro: Matelea grisebachiana, commonly known as the gray-leaved matelea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other plants with milky sap. The plant features showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. Its leaves are usually grayish-green and have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Matelea grisebachiana is often found in rocky or well-drained soils at higher elevations.
